intro: Gynostemma laxum, commonly known as the creeping gynostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Gynostemma laxum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses in herbal medicine.
